title: Wealth Management Tech Writer at Open Systems Technologies (New York City, NY)
text:
StartWire Job Description 
The candidate will be responsible for working with the IT staff to review/document systems architecture, data models and data dictionaries. 
The candidate will be responsible for reviewing/updating/creating procedural frameworks and documentation for interfaces and workflows across the wealth technical spectrum. The candidate is required to have prior experience with IT documentation writing. The candidate will be critical in meeting regulatory expectations. 
Core accountabilities The candidate must possess strong research skills, including gathering and analyzing data from multiple sources (subject matter experts, project managers, programmers). The candidate will have superb interpersonal communication skills, particularly where technical/operational information must be conveyed in a clear and convincing way. The candidate must have strong analytical, planning, organizational, and time management skills. The candidate must have the ability to work individually and function effectively as part of a team. The candidate must possess the ability to maintain discretion and confidentiality. 
Role requirements The ideal candidate will have proven technical writing and editing skills and must have proficient computer skills, especially Microsoft Office applications. The successful candidate must have the ability to meet aggressive deadlines, and to understand and follow managerial direction. 
Professional/technical experience The successful candidate will have prior experience in IT, preferably in the Financial industry, as well as experience in writing technical documentation, data modelling, using tools such as Rational Rose or others.
